data.title: 23 Best Movies Set in Greece You Must Watch
data.meta_description: Looking for inspiration for your next holiday? Amazing! You just landed at the most comprehensive list of the best movies set in Greece.
data.text:
If you’re looking for inspiration for your next holiday, you’re at the right place! I’ve put together the most comprehensive list of the best movies set in Greece.

The truth is that a movie is one of the best ways for a country to gain popularity. It’s just the perfect marketing!

It is also a great way for the viewer to gain insights into a country. Apart from the beautiful images of the Greek islands, the Greek cities, and the Greek mountains a lot of the movies that I have listed in this post, are a window into Greek culture.

By watching these movies, you will quickly understand why the Greek islands are so popular, why people across the globe fall in love with the mesmerizing Aegean Sea, and why Athens is one of the most-visited cities in Europe.

However, apart from appreciating the beauty of Greece, you will also appreciate Greek culture. And I’m not so much referring to Greek culture as this is taught in schools through the lens of Greek mythology and the history of Ancient Greece.

Mostly, some of these movies offer you an insight into the notion of Greek hospitality, and the value of family and friendship in Greek culture.

So grab your remote, your popcorn, and your….credit card because trust me, you’re gonna wanna book that flight and visit us, after watching these movies that are set in gorgeous Greece.

Best Movies Set in Greece -Thrillers & Action

The Guns of Navarone (1961)

Starring: Gregory Peck, David Niven and Anthony Quinn.

Genre: Adventure War Drama

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Rhodes.

Plot: It is 1943 and Europe is battered by the Second World War. The Nazis are holding hostage 2000 British soldiers on the Greek island of Leros. They have also placed two large-caliber guns on the nearby (fictional) island of Navarone in order to prevent the Axis powers to rescue them. When everything else fails, the Allied forces decide to form an elite commando group to reach the top of the rock and destroy the cannons.

Notable Awards: The movie won a Golden Globe Award for Best Motion Picture – Drama, and for Best Original Score – Motion Picture. It also won an Academy Award for Best Special Effects.

Fun fact: In honor of the actor, the area where the movie was shot is still known as Anthony Quinn Bay. In fact, Anthony Quinn loved it so much that he wanted to buy land there.

Available to watch: Apple TV, Google Play, YouTube

James Bond 007: For Your Eyes Only (1981)

Starring: Roger Moore and Carol Bouquet.

Genre: Spy film

Filming locations in Greece: Meteora and the island of Corfu.

Plot: After a British Navy ship is sunk off the coast of Albania, Bond takes it upon himself to investigate the circumstances surrounding the death of an archaeologist working for Mi6 and locate traces of the ATAC device before the Russians. In this classic action movie, Bond fights the bad guys on the beautiful Greek island of Corfu among other places.

Fun fact: The monks who lived in the monastery on top of Meteora Mountain tried to sabotage the filming. They altered the exteriors of the monasteries with plastic sheets because, supposedly, they didn’t like how violent the film was. Eventually, after a special hearing of the Greek Supreme Court, the monks were forced to remove the plastic sheets and filming resumed successfully.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, YouTube

The Bourne Identity (2002)

Starring: Matt Damon.

Genre: Action-thriller

Filming locations in Greece: On the island of Mykonos.

Plot: Jason Bourne manages to survive with two bullets in the back. When he finally comes out of the coma, he realizes that he has completely lost his memory. The search to find his identity again leads Bourne to Athens, Zurich, and Paris. But after another assassination attempt on him, Bourne realizes that some people definitely want him dead.

Fun fact: Although a large part of the movie takes place in Athens, these scenes are actually shot in Tenerife in Spain.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, HBO Max, Netflix, YouTube

Lara Croft: Tomb Raider – The Cradle of Life (2003)

Starring: Angelina Jolie and Gerard Buttler.

Genre: Action-adventure

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Santorini.

Plot: A powerful earthquake on Santorini island uncovers the Luna Temple. It was a temple that Alexander the Great had built to store his most precious treasures. Amongst these treasures, Lara Croft will find clues that will lead her closer to Pandora’s Box which is hidden in Africa in an area called the cradle of life. Lara Croft’s mission is to find the infamous box before it falls into the hands of mad Nobel scientist Dr. Jonathan Rice.

Fun fact: I guess this is not so much a fact. It’s more of a gossip but according to the locals, Angelina Jolie made a great impression while filming in Santorini with her simplicity and kindness. She was also so enchanted by the island that she went back a few years later with her then husband Brad Pitt and their children.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, HBO Max, YouTube

The Two Faces of January (2014)

Starring: Viggo Mortensen, Kirsten Dunst and Oscar Isaac.

Filming locations in Greece: Athens and Crete.

Genre: Action thriller

Plot: Chester and Colette are an American couple on vacation in Athens in 1962. During a visit to the Acropolis, they meet Rydal, an American tour guide who scams tourists. When Chester accidentally kills a detective, their trip turns into a manhunt of life and death, as they will use any means to they can leave the country

Fun fact: There are only 4 movies in total that were able to get a permit for filming on the Acropolis of Athens and this is the latest of them.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, YouTube

Tin Soldier (currently in post-production)

Starring: Jamie Foxx, Robert De Niro, and Scott Eastwood.

Filming locations in Greece: In Thessaloniki and Drama which are both cities in northern Greece.

Genre: Action thriller

Plot: The Bokushi creates a program for US veterans who are seeking their purpose and way to move forward. However, the US Government is concerned with how fast this cult-like and well-armed group is growing.

Notable awards: (I will update this once the movie airs)

Fun fact: According to the president of the local hotels federation, the stars and the crew of the production were particularly fond of the Greek food. So much so, that they requested to have a spit-roasted goat prepared for them to try.

Available to watch: (I will update this once the movie airs)

The Bricklayer (currently in post-production)

Starring: Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev, and Clifton Collins Jr.

Filming locations in Greece: In Thessaloniki.

Genre: Action thriller

Plot: (I will update this once the movie airs)

Notable awards: (I will update this once the movie airs)

Fun fact: According to THETOC, in an attempt to relax the extras, a production member told them “You’re not going to the slaughterhouse. You’re just going out.”

Available to watch: (I will update this once the movie airs)

Best Movies Set in Greece – Drama

Zorba the Greek (1964)

Starring: Anthony Quinn, Alan Bates, and Irene Papas.

Genre: Comedy-drama

Filming locations in Greece: The movie is set and filmed on the island of Crete.

Plot: I think it’s safe to say that of all the movies that are set in Greece, this is probably the most iconic. It is a story about being truly free in spirit. An intrepid English writer, Basil, inherits a lignite mine and hires the eccentric and courageous Zorba, who will lead him into worlds of excitement and danger.

Notable awards: The movie had a whooping total of 15 nominations at the Oscars, the Golden Globes, and the British Academy Film Awards combined. However, in the end, it won three Oscars (Best Supporting Actress, Best Cinematography, and Best Art Direction).

Fun fact: The traditional Greek dance ‘sirtaki’ became widely popular mainly because of this film. In fact, it is also often called the ‘Zorba dance’ and it is accompanied by music composed by one of the most important Greek composers of all times, Mikis Theodorakis. He actually received a Grammy nomination for Best Score Soundtrack for Visual Media.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, AppleTV, Google Play

You may also like: Where To Stay In Crete & The Best Places to Visit

The Greek Tycoon (1978)

Starring: Anthony Quinn and Jacqueline Bisset.

Genre: Biographical drama

Filming locations in Greece: Athens, Mykonos, and Corfu.

Plot: Though the movie’s credits notably mention that the script is fictional and not based on real people, it is widely known that this isn’t true. The movie depicts the love story of the Greek magnate Aristotle Onassis, and Jacky Kennedy, the widow of US President JFK.

Fun fact: Apparently, Anthony Quinn had originally declined to do the film, but according to IMDB’s trivia, he changed his mind after Jackie Kennedy snubbed him at a restaurant.

Available to watch: YouTube

The Big Blue (1988)

Starring: Jean-Marc Barr, Jean Reno, and Rosanna Arquette.

Genre: Drama

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Amorgos.

Plot: Enzo and Zac are two childhood friends who compete in diving when they are young. Zach, an undefeated freediving champion for six years, will seek out Enzo in the Andes where he lives to bring him back as a rival title contender. Their competitiveness will lead them to situations beyond human ability. This classic French film has breathtakingly beautiful underwater scenes that are hard to forget. It is honestly one of my favorite movies set in Greece simply because of how beautifully it depicts the blueness of the Aegean sea.

Fun fact: If you are ever lucky enough to visit the beautiful Greek island of Amorgos, you will notice that there are many French tourists, which is to a very large extent due to this film.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime

Captain Corelli’s Mandolin (2001)

Starring: Penelope Cruz and Nicolas Cage.

Genre: War film

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Kefalonia.

Plot: The movie is set in World War II Greece. Α platoon of Italian soldiers arrives in Kefalonia to reinforce the presence of the Nazi forces on the island. A passionate romance gradually develops between the philandering Italian captain and the betrothed daughter of the local doctor, until, inevitably, war reaches the shores of the island.

Fun fact: The beach of Horgota which features in the movie, is also known as Pelagia’s beach after the name of the female lead character.

Available to watch:Amazon Prime, AppleTV , Google Play

Before Midnight (2013)

Starring: Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy.

Filming locations in Greece: In Messinia, which is an area in the southwestern part of the Peloponnese region.

Genre: Romantic drama

Plot: The sequel to Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004), Before Midnight is the third installment in the Before trilogy. Jesse and Céline are traveling to Greece with their twin daughters and Jesse’s son. The couple reflects on their time together and wonders if they would choose each other if they had met today.

Fun fact: I actually have two fun facts for you! Firstly, the house that Jesse and Celine stay at was actually Patrick Leigh Fermor’s house, and it is absolutely stunning. Secondly, the soundtrack of the movie entitled ‘Gia ena tango‘ (i.e For a tango), is written and performed by Harris Alexiou who is considered one of Greece’s most important female singers of all times.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, AppleTV, Google Play

The Lost Daughter (2021)

Starring: Olivia Colman, Dakota Johnson, and Jessie Buckley.

Genre: Psychological drama

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Spetses in the Saronic Gulf.

Plot: Leda is a middle-aged divorced woman devoted to her job as an English teacher and her two children. She decides to take a vacation by the sea, in a small coastal town in Greece. When a small, seemingly insignificant event occurs, Leda is flooded with memories of the difficult, unconventional choices she made as a mother and their consequences for her and her family. The seemingly peaceful story of joyful self-rediscovery soon becomes the story of a wild confrontation with an unsettled past.

Notable awards: It has more than 50 nominations including three Academy Awards, two BAFTAs, and two Golden Globes. Overall, the movie and its creators have won more than twenty awards in total, including a Golden Osella for Best Screenplay at the Venice International Film Festival.

Fun fact: The movie was shot in the summer of 2020 when the world was still pretty much numb from the appearance of Covid-19. In order for the filming to take place, the municipal council of the island had to take a vote. Luckily, they voted unanimously to give access to the public spaces that were needed for the film.

Available to watch: Netflix

Best Movies Set in Greece – Romance & Comedy

Boy on a Dolphin (1957)

Starring: Sophia Loren, Alan Ladd, and Clifton Webb.

Filming locations in Greece: Mostly filmed on the island of Hydra. However, it also includes shots from Athens, Delphi, Corinth, Meteora, Poros, Rhodes, Delos, Mykonos, and Santorini.

Genre: Romantic adventure.

Plot: Phaedra is a poor Greek sponge diver on the island of Hydra. She is swimming when she accidentally finds an ancient Greek statue of a boy riding a dolphin on the bottom of the Aegean Sea. She tries to sell it to the highest bidder but she has to deal with two competing individuals. On the one hand, Dr. James Calder, who is an honest archaeologist who will surrender it to Greek authorities. On the other hand, Victor Parmalee, a smuggler and dealer of historic artefacts.

Fun fact: Funnily enough, the opening of the movie includes a credit to the Greek islands.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, YouTube

You may also like: The 15 Best Places to Visit in Greece for Couples

Summer Lovers (1982)

Starring: Peter Gallagher, Daryl Hannah and Valerie Quennessen.

Filming locations in Greece: Santorini.

Genre: Romantic comedy

Plot: An American young couple goes on vacation to the Greek islands. There, the man meets a French archaeologist with whom the couple will come very close.

Opa! (2005)

Starring: Matthew Modine.

Genre: Romantic comedy.

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Patmos.

Plot: Eric arrives from Chicago on the Greek island of Patmos. He plans to continue his long-deceased father Phillip’s quest for St. John the Evangelist’s mythical cup near the dig run by old archaeology professor Tierney. Even though he manages to locate it, it’s under the profitable tavern of Katerina, who also won his heart.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime

Mamma Mia! (2008)

Starring: Christine Baranski, Pierce Brosnan, Dominic Cooper, Colin Firth, Amanda Seyfried, Stellan Skarsgård, Meryl Streep, and Julie Walters.

Genre: Musical romantic comedy

Filming locations in Greece: The islands of Skopelos and Skiathos, and Pelion Peninsula.

Plot: In what is arguably one of the most popular movies set in Greece – if not the most popular – we follow the story of Donna and her daughter Sophie. Sophie is determined to find out who her real father is even though her mother refuses to reveal it. When she finds her mother’s diary, she decides to invite three men who all slept with Donna during a certain summer period. When all the guests arrive at the fictional island of Kalokairi, which means summer is Greek, the story begins to unravel.

Notable awards: National Movie Award for Best Musical and Best Female Performance (Meryl Streep).

Fun fact: Although the movie is primarily filmed on the island of Skopelos and Pelion, it was actually Skiathos that was widely marketed as the Mamma Mia! island. As a result, the island’s fame and popularity skyrocketed among international and local tourists. And not that Skiathos isn’t beautiful, but how unfair is that for Skopelos and Pelion??

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, Apple TV, Google Play, YouTube

My Life in Ruins (2009)

Starring: Nia Vardalos and Richard Dreyfuss.

Filming locations in Greece: Athens, Ancient Olympia and Delphi.

Genre: Romantic comedy

Plot: Greek-American Georgia has just gotten a divorce and in an attempt to gain control of her life, she comes to Greece to work as a tour guide. Her plan seems to be going completely wrong when Irv Gordon comes into her life. He will teach her how to have fun and let go, and will also bring her close to the young bus driver.

Fun fact: It’s the first movie to get permission to film on the Acropolis of Athens since 1957’s Italian film Boy on a Dolphin.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, AppleTV, HBO max, Google Play

High Season (1987)

Starring: Jacqueline Bisset and James Fox.

Genre: Romantic comedy

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Rhodes.

Plot: It is the story of an English photographer who lives quietly in a village in Rhodes with her daughter. Much to her surprise, her ex-husband arrives on the island and has been commissioned to create a modern sculpture dedicated to the “Unknown Tourist”.

Fun fact: Along with A Month in the Country which also aired in 1987, High Season is Kenneth Branagh’s first credited role in a movie.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime

Shirley Valentine (1989)

Starring: Pauline Collins and Tom Conti.

Genre: Comedy-drama

Filming locations in Greece: The island of Mykonos.

Plot: Shirley is a middle-aged housewife from Liverpool, who feels trapped in her boring life and decides to rebel. When her friend wins a free holiday in Greece, her life changes radically.

Notable awards: The movie received numerous nominations and went on to win a BAFTA for Best Actress in a Leading Role (Pauline Collins), as well as Top Comedy Film at the British Comedy Awards.

Fun fact: There’s a famous scene from the movie where Shirley is sitting at a quiet beach gazing at the sun setting in the Aegean sea. The scene was filmed at the beach of Agios Ioannis which is one of the most popular beaches on the island. And let’s just say, it’s not as quiet as it is depicted in the movie.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, AppleTV

Mediterraneo (1991)

Starring: Diego Abatantuono, Claudio Bigagli, and Giuseppe Cederna

Genre: Comedy-drama

Filming locations in Greece: The movie was filmed on the tiny island of Kastellorizo. It is actually the easternmost inhabited Greek island.

Plot: A group of not-so-skilled Italian soldiers arrives on an isolated island in the Aegean. Their mission is to guard the island in the name of Mussolini and Fascism. Although they think the place is full of enemies, they find only a handful of women and their children. They get carried away by the simple life of the locals, the bright sun, and the Aegean sea, and forget why they got there in the first place.

Notable awards: Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

Fun fact: The plot of the movie is said to be based on a collection of short stories entitled Sagapò, published in 1953 by Venetian writer Renzo Biasion. The fun fact is that Sagapò is a phonetic writing of the Greek I love you.

Available to watch: AppleTV

Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants (2005) & Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2 (2008)

Starring: America Ferrera, Amber Tamblyn, Blake Lively, and Alexis Bledel.

Filming Locations in Greece: The island of Santorini.

Plot: And our list of movies that are set in Greece, ends with these 00s classic movies. In the first movie we see the four 16-year-old best friends, separating from each other for the first time to go on vacation. On the last day they all go shopping together, they find a pair of jeans that fit them all perfectly. So they decide that jeans will be the connecting link between them. Each wears it for a week before sending it to the next. In a magical way, and while they are far away, they experience all the love, loss and strong friendship, in a summer that will be unforgettable. The sequel follows a similar storyline with the best friends now having just finished the first year of college.

Fun fact: While filming the sequel of the film in Santorini, Blake Lively stepped on a sea urchin. The doctors had to remove the spikes one by one, because well..this is what you have to do if you step on a sea urchin.

Available to watch: Amazon Prime, AppleTV, Google Play, HBO max, YouTube & for the sequel Amazon Prime, AppleTV, Google Play, HBO max, YouTube

And there you have it. These are the best movies set in Greece you need to watch today!

Are there any movies set in Greece that I forgot to include in this list?

Please let me know down below!

Until the next time..

Kat x
